caseTitle: Ghulam Rasool v. Government of Pakistan, thr. Secretary Establishment Division, Islamabad & others
tagline: It is the exclusive preserve of the Federal Government to appoint heads of statutory bodies, autonomous bodies, semi-autonomous bodies, regulatory bodies etc. as also to make appointments on merits under the Acts/Ordinances wherein certain criteria has been laid down for such purpose. However, the Court's deference to the Executive Authority lasts for only as long as the Executive makes a manifest and demonstrable effort to comply with and remain within the legal limits which circumscribe its power.
